meaning_str.bing:
n. 神经；勇气；神经质；神经紧张
v. 鼓足勇气；振作精神
网络. 胆量；精力；叶脉

神经；勇气；神经质；神经紧张

神经；勇气；胆量；魄力；精神力量；决心；坚定
鼓舞；激励；使振作；给予勇气；使有劲；使奋进；使坚强；增强信心

1.en: Speaking out usually involved what was for me a slightly nerve-wracking trip to the front of the class.
1.cn: 口语表达通常还要在全班同学面前用汉语表达自己，这对我来说是个颇有些让人紧张的部分。

2.en: I got up the nerve to ask him if his name was Mr. Gillespie, and if he had been in a coma about five years ago.
2.cn: 我鼓起了勇气，问他是否是吉莱斯皮先生，他是否在5年前昏迷过。

3.en: Today George Miller actually had the nerve to ask me to go the the Christmas dance with him!
3.cn: 今天乔治米勒居然敢来邀我和他一起去参加圣诞节的舞会。

0.en: Tablets for nerve pain. Now, you can give him painkillers, if he asks.
0.cn: 神经止痛药片，如果他要吃，你可以给他止痛药。

1.en: Wait! My fault! I accidentally tweaked his facial nerve. And may have also stopped his heart.
1.cn: 等等，我的错，不小心扎到颜面神经，好像也把心给扎停了。

2.en: Actually, ethyl alcohol inhibits electrical conduction in the nerve cells and stimulates reuptake receptors of inhibitory neurotranmitters like gamma Aminobutyric acid.
2.cn: 事实上，酒精会抑制神经细胞的电传导，并会刺激感受器重新摄取抑制性神经递质，比如伽马氨基丁酸。

3.en: If life starts approximately a billion years ago we will have to wait four hundred thousand years to see the aberration of the first nerve cells.
3.cn: 生命出现在大约十亿年前,但还要再过四十万年，第一批神经细胞才会发生畸变。

4.en: I use electromagnetic waves to stimulate their olfactory nerve center. I speak to them. I can go anywhere, hear anything, and see everything.
4.cn: 我用电磁波刺激它们的嗅觉神经中枢，和它们讲话，我无所不在，眼观六路，耳听八方。

5.en: Good evening, Mr. Hunt. The weapons you recovered in Belarus were confirmed to be VX nerve gas, capable of devastating a major city.
5.cn: 晚上好，亨特先生，你从白俄罗斯带回的武器已经被确认是VX神经毒气，其威力足以摧毁一座大型城市。

6.en: When something really great happens in your life, say you fall in love, there is an increase in the release of serotonin from nerve cells, which ultimately stimulates your body and makes you feel happy.
6.cn: 比方说生命中某件大事发生了，例如谈恋爱神经细胞中的复合胺就会增加，进而刺激你的身体，让你感到快乐。

7.en: We were no match for his nerve attack. He's gotten stronger.
7.cn: 我们对他的点穴功毫无招架之力，他功夫更高了。

8.en: You have got some nerve coming back here. I can't believe you never called me.
8.cn: 你有种，还敢回来，你竟不打电话给我。

9.en: Which is another way of saying he doesn't have the nerve to compete. You scared?
9.cn: 意思也就是他没有胆量来较量。你害怕吗？

10.en: Did I pluck a nerve there? Oh, yeah. Okay. All right, everybody, it's time to eat.
10.cn: 我是不是踩到地雷了？对，好吧，好吧，大家，该吃饭了。

11.en: You see, I don't get a suit of armor. I'm exposed. Like a nerve. It's a nightmare.
11.cn: 算了吧 我可没有你的护甲，凭我这肉身就去玩命，别开玩笑了。

12.en: Mr. Secretary. You got some nerve. I'll give you that. You could use some of that right now.
12.cn: 国务卿先生。你好大胆。这我承认。你现在正需要点胆呢。

13.en: Unbelievable. You have some nerve showing up here just to schmooze with the tenure committee.
13.cn: 真是难以置信，你居然有脸跑这儿来找教职委员会的人闲聊。

14.en: Anyway, I don't wanna do it in front of someone with a tail. Hey, you swore you would nerve tell.
14.cn: 我不想在有尾巴的人面前打。你发誓不说的。

15.en: An insurance policy, in case you lose your nerve, which you have. So now, if they take the lads, she will lead them straight back to you.
15.cn: 一个保险措施，防止你临阵退缩，就是现在的这种情况。所以如果他们被捕，她就会让所有的矛头都只向你。

16.en: No, no, I keep trying, you know? I can get out, "Joey, I have too" but then I lose my nerve and I always finish with, "go to the bathroom." He may think I'm sick.
16.cn: 还没，我试了好几次，我只能说出“乔伊，我得…”然后就退缩，改说“去上厕所”，他可能以为我有病。

17.en: Now, I know what you're going to say. I made a commitment to Bernadette and to your family and I've got a hell of a lot of nerve coming in here and demanding that we postpone this thing.
17.cn: 我知道你想说什么，我已对伯纳黛特和您家作出承诺，我鼓起万般勇气来到这里提出延期的要求实在是太过分了。
